slide.title: WCAG Requirements related to Navigation Menus

tr.td: A
Use of nav element to create a navigation landmark region to identify the menu of links.

The buttons and links in the menu can be accessed and operated using only the keyboard.

The text content of the links is used as the accessible name for the buttons and links.

The buttons to show the popup links use the button role and the aria-expanded attribute.

The link or button with keyboard focus can easily determined visually.
AAA
Using the aria-current property to identify the link to the current page.

contents.p: Primary keyboard commands are the keyboard commands that are supported by the native HTML semantics and the ARIA markup for the menu items.

tr.td: Moves focus to the next visible item in the top level menu or a submenu.
If focus is on a top level menu item with a submenu, the sub menu is opened.

ul.li: If focus is on a top level menu item with a submenu, the sub menu is opened.
If focus is on a menu item that is a link, it follows the link.

tr.td: If focus is on a submenu item, closes the submenu and places focus on the top level menu item.

contents.p: Keyboard enhancements are keyboard commands that are discovered through inspection (e.g. people just trying the keys due to visual affordances of the menu). There no native HTML or ARIA semantics provided to assistive technologies to identify these keys as supported features of the menu.

contents.h3: Changes to top level menu item with sub menus
contents.p: The top level menu items with submenus are updated by the disclosure menu script to support the behaviors and markup for the ARIA disclosure pattern. The disclosure pattern is the most popular way to implement navigation menus with submenus. Top level menu items that do not have submenus do not have the following changes.

tr.td: The a element will no longer act as a link, but a button to open and close the submenu. This requires change the a element semantics from "link" to "button" by adding the role attribute with the value of button.

To change the behavior of the a element to no longer behave as a link, the href is set to # character. This change keeps the a element from changing the page if activated and also keeps the a element in the tab sequence of the page.
The aria-expanded attribute identifies if the group of submenu links are visible or hidden.
The aria-controls attribute defines a relationship between the button and the group of submenu links.
Adds an accessible name to the nav element.
Adds a hamburger button to open and close the navigation menu when screen is narrow or on a small device.
Inline SVG graphic

The SVG graphics is used to indicate the action of the menu item:
If the menu item has a submenu, the SVG graphic indicates using up and down cheverons that the menu item has a submenu and whether the submenu is opened or closed.
If the menu item is a link, a right pointing cheveron is used to differentiate the menu item from menu items with a submenu.
Inline SVG graphics are used to support the use of the currentColor property to make sure the graphic is visible and has enough contrast in operating system high contrast modes.

contents.p: WordPress menus do not render the link to the current page as an a element and this must be restored so that the link is part of the tab sequence of the page and the aria-current attribute can be used to indicate the link is to the current page.

tr.td: WordPress does not render the current page link in the menu as an a element, but as an span element. The disclosure menu script changes to a a element.
The href attribute is added to the a element using the current page URL.
To identify the link as the link to the current page the aria-current attribute is added to the a element.

slide.title: Update on SkipTo.js: CDN and default configuration

ul.li:
Referencing the SkipTo.js script:
Include a reference to the CDN version of the script: https://cdn.disability.illinois.edu/skipto.min.js.
Alternatively you can include reference a local copy of the skipto.min.js script in the page or page template.

Changes to default configuration:
The "Action menu items" are now disabled by default.
Tooltip appears on keyboard focus in addition to pointer hover on shortcut key information.
